newsitem.title: USA: U.S. Robotics names McCartney as president.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Robotics names McCartney as president.

text.p: U.S. Robotics Corp said Friday that John McCartney, its executive vice president and chief operating officer, has been named president.
McCartney will retain his duties as chief operating officer.
Casey Cowell remains chairman and chief executive officer, the company said in a statement.

McCartney, 44, has worked for U.S. Robotics for 13 years. He lead the company's international growth in the four years he managed those operations. International sales grew from $6.6 million in 1990 to $176 million in 1995. He also played a key role in the company's initial public offering, U.S. Robotics said.
McCartney joined U.S. Robotics in 1984 as vice president of finance and chief financial officer.
"This transition recognizes the excellent leadership that has made U.S. Robotics successful," said Cowell, in a statement.
As president and chief operating officer, McCartney will continue to be responsible for the management of business operations for U.S. Robotics worldwide.
Cowell will focus his efforts on technology planning and the future strategic direction of the company.

U.S. Robotics supplies products and systems that provide access to information. It designs, makes, markets and supports remote access servers, LAN switching equipment, desktop/mobile client products and modems, telephony products and handheld organizers.
